articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: 'Oppenheimer' finally premieres in Japan to mixed reactions and high emotions - NBC News
articles.description: “Oppenheimer” finally premiered Friday in Japan, the only nation to be attacked by the nuclear weapons invented by the American scientist who inspired the film.
articles.content: Oppenheimer does not directly depict what happened on the ground when the bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, turning some 100,000 people instantly into ashes, and killed thousands more in … [+2967 chars]

articles.title: US CDC alerts healthcare providers of increase in meningococcal disease - ETHealthWorld
articles.description: An infection with this strain had disproportionately affected people aged 30-60 years, African American people, and people with HIV, the agency said, urging healthcare providers to have a "heightened suspicion" for meningococcal disease among these population…

articles.author: Jonathan O'Callaghan
articles.title: North American eclipse 2024: How scientists will study it - BBC.com
articles.description: Rockets, planes, balloons and countless observers on the ground will be studying the North American total solar eclipse on 8 April in unprecedented detail.
